title: KoCAA: A values-based investing partnership built on precision and trust
content:
Knights of Columbus Asset Advisors 
			

						
			Knights of Columbus Asset Advisors (KoCAA) is a faith-driven investment advisory firm managing approximately $29.5 billion in assets. With a mission to provide Catholic-compliant investment solutions, KoCAA serves the investment needs of its parent company, the Knights of Columbus, as well as a growing number of institutional and individual investors across the United States.  
The firm’s strategy spans both fixed income and equity, with every investment screened in accordance with the ethical guidelines set forth by the United States Conference of Catholic Bishops. 
			

						FEATURED PRODUCTS

			



					
    
                
        
            


															
INDUSTRY
Asset Management
LOCATION
New Haven, Connecticut
GOAL
Finding a benchmark that accurately mirrors the company’s investable universe
				
			
		

						
				
			Key insights
			

			


				Traditional market benchmarks failed to reflect the company’s constraints and intentions behind its portfolios, creating murkiness and making performance comparisons difficult. 


				Collaboration with Bloomberg resulted in highly customized indexes tailored to serve the needs of the company’s clients. 


				Bloomberg’s index solution was more cost-effective, without compromising on quality or service. 

			
		


      The Bloomberg team has been highly collaborative, interested in getting stuff done, wants to work with us to make sure that we’re getting what we need.


          James Gaul
          Vice President and Portfolio Manager, KoCAA
        


						
				
															Situation									
							

	KoCAA is carefully filtering investments to align with faith-based mandates. Over the past two years the company’s monthly inflows doubled from $15 million to $30 million. Like many values-driven firms, KoCAA faced a persistent challenge. Traditional market benchmarks failed to reflect the constraints and intentions behind its portfolios. Standard indexes that included companies that KoCAA would never invest in for ethical reasons made performance comparisons difficult and, in many cases, misleading. 

			
				
															Filtering investments to align with faith-based mandates									
							
				
															Increased demand for portfolios that reflect clients' personal or organizational convictions									
							


			
		

						
				
															Problem									
							

	Existing index providers offered limited solutions, which were often expensive, inflexible, or misaligned with KoCAA’s needs. What the firm required was a benchmark that accurately mirrored their investable universe, enabled clearer performance narratives, and reinforced client confidence in its approach. 

			
				
															Existing solutions limited given price and lack of flexibility									
							
				
															Searching for a benchmark that accurately mirrors the investable universe									
							


			
		

						
				
															Solution									
							

	KoCAA engaged Bloomberg to build a custom equity benchmark that would reflect the firm’s unique investment universe, aligned with Catholic guidelines. Bloomberg brought both its proprietary data and third-party sources to the table, ensuring that the benchmark would reflect Catholic social and moral teaching with a high degree of precision. KoCAA also benefitted from the Bloomberg Industry Classification System (BICS), which allowed for detailed, hierarchical industry definitions that gave the company the control it needed down to the subsector level. 

			
				
															Built a tailored benchmark									
							
				
															Developed precise screening using BICS industry definitions									
							

			
		

      Now we can spend our time focusing on decisions that we made and how that relates to performance, rather than benchmark structure, which is outside our control.


          Nick Gentile
          Interim President and Chief Investment Officer, KoCAA
